Install Tycho Configurator as an additional maven connector

subsection.name: SysML
subsection.p: Have a look to the normative document of OMG: Embedded norm

subsection.name: Check your installation by a basic checkout, compilation

ul.li: Clone the sysml 16 git repository git clone https://git.eclipse.org/r/papyrus/org.eclipse.papyrus-sysml.
Run maven at the root of the repo: mvn clean install; it should pass
Get sysml16 plugins in your eclipse workspace
Et “Voila” you are good to go.

subsection.name: Target Environment
subsection.p: We have developed a target-platform-configuration artifact located at /org.eclipse.papyrus-sysml/org.eclipse.papyrus.sysml16.targetdef/org.eclipse.papyrus.sysml16.targetdef.target
Open it and click at the upper right corner to set it has the target platform.

subsection.name: Generate and deploy the web site
A minimal iteration
subsection.p: This section describes the different steps relative to the integration of a new feature or to the correction of a bug: from bug definition, to requirement, to code integration through gerrit review with the continuous integration system.

ul.li: Describe in Bugzilla the bug, feature you are working on. Please use the component SysML. And begins with [SysML 1.6] for Summary.
Get the code from the master with git,git clone https://git.eclipse.org/r/papyrus/org.eclipse.papyrus-sysml, and work on a local branch,
Add the new requirement in the different sysml 1.1 models located in the doc folder of the relevant plugin. have a look to SOP4: Requirement
After a few iteration, you code should be merged and accessible in the master.

subsection.p: Have a look to default rules miscellaneous.html

subsection.name: Tips
subsection.p: If you are working with multiple version of Papyrus, it is possible that Tycho do not pull the right one. You can force it by using the following parameter in the build command. More details here
Please find additional information here: Miscellaneous

li.a: SOP1: OMG Norm requirements automanual extraction
SOP2: From a OMG profile to a dedicated Papyrus application (elementype, palette etc...)
SOP3: Extended the norm by adding a new operation.
